Authors: Meiryani, Olivia, Sudrajat J., Daud Z.M.
Title: The effect of firm's size on corporate performance
Source title: International Journal of Advanced Computer Science and Applications
Affiliations: Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Entrepreneuship Center, Management Departement BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Accounting and Finance, Faculty of Economics and Management, Universiti Putra, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Meiryani, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Olivia, Accounting Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sudrajat, J., BINUS Entrepreneuship Center, Management Departement BINUS Business School, Undergraduate Program Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Daud, Z.M., Department of Accounting and Finance, Faculty of Economics and Management, Universiti Putra, Malaysia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of capital structure on firm's financial performance that is conducted on 55 manufacturing sector listed companies in Indonesia Stock Exchange. The data analysis is conducted using R Studio software. Study is used data panel analysis with random effect model. The result of this study are (1) firm's size has no effect on firm's financial performance which is proxied by return-on-assets; (2) firm's size has no effect on firm's financial performance which is proxied by market-to-book-value. © 2020 Science and Information Organization.
Author Keywords: Financial performance; Firm size; Market to book value; Return on assets
Funding Text 1: Thanks to BINUS University Jakarta Indonesia.
